result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah L Mastaglio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. May serve 2nd half on electronic monitor-zero day credit - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay fine, costs & DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

No contact with Copps in Stevens Point.
No contact with co-defendant's Jennifer Carter or Cassandra Hassley.

May be transfered to Racine County.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.

Pay fine, costs & DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah L Mastaglio

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations and Final Reminder Notice - not deliverable as addressed

Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. 
Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant to be issued.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

DA Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court - no restitution as items were retuned. 
Atty Halverson concurs and requests transfer to Racine County and requests expungement and early discharge.

BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION****
I/S Sentence: 90 days jail w/huber w/2nd half on electronic monitor-zero day credit - stayed 
Probation: 24 months, may be transfered to Racine County
Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
No contact with Copps in Stevens Point.
No contact with co-defendant's Jennifer Carter or Cassandra Hassley.  
  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
Pay $100 fine + DNA surcharges = $664.00.
Expungement option, if successfully completes.

9:38 a.m. Defendant Sarah L Mastaglio in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. DA Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.
Pretrialed this morning and ready to proceed to plea & sentencing.

ADDRESS INFO for Sarah L Mastaglio
Current: 1224 11th Street, Upper 1/2, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2016)
Prior: 220 Miller Ave. Apt 107, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jennifer Carter or Copps in Stevens Point.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Atty Halverson to file paperwork today for the waiver. 
Defendant needs to be present for the arraignment.
Atty Constable does not object to Atty Halverson filing an authorization for the PTC.

Defendant Sarah L Mastaglio in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson.  Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:06 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends a $2500.00 signature bond with conditions as stated  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not in Court today. Defendant was mailed the complaint at last known address and there is an affidavit of mailing in the DA's file. BTC:  Court finds probable cause.  Criminal Warrant with $500 cash alternative.
